title: Dry Tortugas National Park: Things To Do
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Things To Do             Things To Do          Â    Almost 70 miles west of Key West lies the remote Dry Tortugas National Park. The 100-square mile park is mostly open water with seven small islands. The park is known the world over as the home of magnificent Fort Jefferson, picturesque blue waters, superlative coral reefs and marine life, and the vast assortment of bird life that frequent the area.   To learn more about things to do in the park, follow the links below:      Fort Jefferson Tours   Ranger Guided Programs   Junior Ranger Program   Swimming   Snorkeling and Diving   Camping   Boating   Geocaching   Paddlesports   Recreational Fishing   Wildlife Viewing   Guided Tours
